title: Setting up NEW Thunderbird
creator: jennysadlier20
content: I have had quite a problem with my Thunderbird account for months and I have not been able to send any emails on my Computer - this seemed to be to do with the Setting for outgoing emails. I was missing '465' and I have now learnt that by seeing it in my NEW Account which just popped up in front of me??? I did the set up, and it seemed to be going OK, however, I only have a Deleted Items and Junk Folder, with absolutely NO CONTACTS. After doing some reading up, apparently I should have an update bar at the bottom right hand corner - NO. Now the Icon seems to have disappeared as well. So I can no longer look at the NEW account. Simply fixing my OLD email account by (possibly) adding '465' into Port section of the STMP Server page would be good. Wow, YES, it now allows me to use my OLD account to SEND an email - Yeehaa! HOWEVER, I cannot download new emails. So, on my Computer, the latest email coming IN is dated 12/01/2025. My emails DO come in to my iPad, so I am not totally missing out, however ALL of my Historical Emails which are VITAL to keep due to legal repercussions, are on my Computer and I am no longer able to add items to those folders. Desperate Jenny
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/134.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 Edg/134.0.0.0

title: Before sending, check that a particular word is not in the message body
creator: rdiez
content:
Hi all:

Before sending an e-mail, I want check that a particular word (like "my secret") is not in the message body.

Is there any way to do this? I couldn't find any add-on to that end.

If there isn't anything like that, is there any add-on (or an easy way) to run a user-defined script before sending an e-mail? I could then try to write some simple JavaScript code in order to search the message body for a number of words I want to be alerted about.

Failing that, I could use an add-on like Keyword Highlight to automatically highlight unwanted words, but that add-on has been abandoned and does not work anymore. Is there anything similar? I am thinking about something like spell checking, but in reverse, where certain words get underlined in red.

Thanks in advance, 

 rdiez

title: Not able to move emails to folders
creator: debskinner21
content:
Hi I've been using TB for years & have had this issue on & off for a while, but it seems to be getting more frequent/annoying

When I move emails from my inbox (unified inbox) to the various local folders that I've set up, sometimes they move just fine & other times I have to shut TB & re-open it. Usually this is only occasionally, but this morning I could only move about 6 emails before I had to restart TB. All very tedious!

My inbox had got a bit full - circa 250 messages & I was moving to a folder that did have quite a few messages - I think it was about 14,000. I have now moved some of them to another sub folder, which is sort of OK, but a bit of a pain when searching for an email from last year as I now have to go to a different folder to look. I generally keep this year & the past year in my main folder & then put the previous year into a dated folder. I've now moved all 2024 emails to a different folder.

This happens on various sub folders that I've got - often they have circa 12-15,000 emails in

Any ideas?

I do have compact all folders when it will save over 1MB in total set up, so all folders are regularly compacted

Thanks

Il sistema operativo è Windows 11 Home

title: Can't get incoming messages on Yahoo POP3 account
creator: DSW1950
content:
Hi, Having a problem with TB that started on April 9th. It stopped retrieving from my POP3 account that was transferred to Yahoo from Cox Communications 2 years ago. Our IMAP accounts have no problems. I CAN send emails, and the new messages do show on the web portal. My phone can also receive messages. on my PC TB tries for about 10 minutes to get the messages, then shows an error message "The DELE command did not succeed, error marking a message as deleted. Mail server pop.mail.yahoo.com responded too many requests". For a couple of weeks I found some messages never downloaded (most did) but now I get none. Interestingly today when it happened I would hear the audio announcement for the account there was mail, but none showed. Server settings are what is specified, tried restarting in Troubleshoot mode to no effect, and updated TB to next version. Still stuck. Any help is appreciated!

p.s. Just to complicate more, Windows did an update dated April 8, installed sometime on April 9.

Solution found: I found a year-old backup of my TB profile and replaced the existing one with it (after first copying the existing one for safety). That worked, except ALL messages were downloaded again. It appears every time TB tried to access messages it started at the beginning, so there were multiple copies of each old one to delete. A small price to pay for getting TB back online. So the problem was a corrupted profile, reason unknown.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:137.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/137.0;kb_visits_prior:["/en-US/kb/automatic-account-configuration", "/en-US/kb/cannot-receive-messages"]
